conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the motion of a bullet fired from Cart A towards Cart B, considering their respective velocities and the bullet's constant speed relative to the ground.
Cart A is moving to the left with speed \(v_1\), Cart B is moving to the right with speed \(v_2\), and a bullet is fired horizontally from Cart A with speed \(v_0\).
The bullet travels a horizontal distance \(s\) before hitting the target on Cart B.
The displacement of Cart B relative to the ground is \(s_2\).
Since the bullet hits the target when the next bullet has already been fired, the displacement of the bullet \(s\) is equal to the displacement of Cart B \(s_2\).
The time interval between shots is \(\Delta t_0\), and the distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is \(s\).
The total distance traveled by the bullet is incorrectly repeated multiple times as \(s + s_2\).
